title: 110_hr550
content: The Act titled "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. The Act extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property, including solar lighting equipment and excess energy storage devices. The Act extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property, including solar lighting equipment that uses solar energy to illuminate structures with fiber-optic distributed sunlight. Additionally, there are modifications to the energy credit for solar photovoltaic energy property based on kilowatt capacity. The Act extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. The credit for solar photovoltaic energy property is based on kilowatt capacity. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code regarding the application of special rules for rehabilitated or subsidized property. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code regarding the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property will take effect on January 1, 2007, with specific application to property placed in service after December 31, 2006. Extension and modification of credit for residential energy efficient property under Section 3. Extension and modification of the residential energy efficient property credit under Section 3 includes amending the termination date to 2016, removing the 30 percent allowance for solar electric property, and setting maximum credits for different types of qualified properties. The definition of qualified solar water heating property expenditure is amended to include cooling and providing hot water. The definition of qualified photovoltaic property expenditure is amended to include advanced energy storage systems. The credit allowed against alternative minimum tax is modified to limit the credit to the excess of regular tax liability. The credit allowed for the taxable year is limited by the regular tax liability and the tax imposed by section 55. Any excess credit can be carried forward to the next taxable year. Amendments are made to various sections of the tax code to reflect these changes. Amendments to the tax code include adding sections 25D to sections 24(b)(3)(B) and 26(a)(1). These changes apply to expenditures after December 31, 2006. SEC. 4. 3-YEAR ACCELERATED DEPRECIATION PERIOD FOR SOLAR ENERGY PROPERTY AND FUEL CELL PROPERTY. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code related to property descriptions for tax purposes. It includes changes to clauses (iv) and (v) of section 168(e)(3)(A) and a conforming amendment to section 168(e)(3)(B)(vi)(I) regarding wind and solar energy properties. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006, and the last sentence of the section does not apply to the subparagraph.
